intro: Banisteria nemorum, commonly known as the cave vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink, which bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a small, round capsule that splits open to release seeds. Banisteria nemorum is often found growing on rocky surfaces or in shaded, humid environments.
